alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 15 at 1:48PM MST until March 15 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: .Heavy rainfall on a deep primed snowpack has caused increased snow melt and runoff. Flows in several rivers, creeks, and streams have already increased to near or above action or flood stage with additional water rises to critical levels possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues this afternoon through Thursday. * WHERE...Portions of central Arizona, including the lower elevations of Yavapai County and northern Gila County. * WHEN...Through 5 PM MST Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, and swimming holes. Low-water crossings could experience flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread heavy rainfall is occurring and expected to continue into Thursday morning along and south of the Mogollon Rim. Rain and snowmelt have combined to create enhanced runoff and significant flows in area waterways. Several waterways have seen significant rises in flow with additional rises possible. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
